questions.uddipok:
Change the narrative style of the following text:-
"Why are you looking so happy?" Dipa said to Rupali. "My brother sent a mobile phone for me yesterday," replied Rupali. "But What's the use of it to you? I think it is a mere wastage of money?" said Dipa, "No. I can communicate with others in the shortest possible time." said Rupali.

sub_questions.explanation: Dipa asked Rupali why she (R) was looking so happy. Rupali replied that her brother had sent a mobile phone for her the previous day. Hearing this, Dipa asked Rupali what the use of it was to her (R). She added that she thought it was a mere wastage of money. questions.uddipok:
Change the sentences according to directions:-
(a) Long time ago, there lived a young man called Ruplal. (Make compound sentence)
(b) He lived with his family and worked on a farm. (Make interrogative sentence)
(c) It was a beautiful place but there were a lot a problems. (Make complex sentence)
(d) The village people were quarrelsome. (Make negative sentence)
(e) Ruplal decided to go and live alone in the jungle in order to find peace. (Make complex sentence)
(f) So he collected his things and went to live by himself. (Make simple sentence)
(g) Ruplal made a nice little hut for himself in the jungle. (Use passive voice)
(h) How happy I am now! (Make assertive sentence)
(i) My jungle hut is one of the most peaceful places in the world. (Make positive degree)
(j) That night, while Ruplal was sleeping, he heard a noise. (Make simple sentence)

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Long time ago, there lived a man and his name was Ruplal.
(b) Didn't he live with his family and work on a farm?
(c) Though it was a beautiful place, there were a lot of problems.
(d) The village people were not peace-loving.
(e) Ruplal decided to go and live alone in the jungle in order that he could find peace.
(f) So collecting his things, he went to live by himself.
(g) A nice little hut was made by Ruplal for himself in the jungle.
(h) I am very happy now.
(i) Very few places in the world are as peaceful as my jungle hut.
(j) That night Ruplal heard a noise while sleeping.

questions.uddipok: A school magazine gives the students an opportunity to reveal their creative genius. Suppose, your school publishes a school magazine every year Write a paragraph in about 250 words on."A School Magazine."

sub_questions.explanation: A school magazine contains (থাকে) the literary (সাহিত্যবিষয়ক) works and other information (তথ্য) of a school. It is published once a year. To publish it smoothly (সুচারুভাবে), a magazine committee of usually nine members is formed in a general meeting. The members of the committee are chief patron (পৃষ্ঠপোষক), adviser (উপদেষ্টা), editor, assistant editors, business editors, proofreaders, assistant proofreaders, etc. Generally, the Headteacher holds the post of chief patron and a senior teacher becomes the adviser. The editor, business editors and the assistant proofreaders are selected from the students. A magazine fund (তহবিল) is also made up (গঠন করা হয়) of the school 'Magazine Fee'. The editor invites (আহ্বান করে) writings both in Bangla and English. Then, after proper scrutiny (স্ক্রুটিনি-নিরীক্ষণ), the best ones are selected for publishing. The business editors collect some money by selling spaces (স্থান) in the magazine for advertisements. Generally, the magazine has two sections - Bangla and English. There are messages (বাণী) from the Headteacher and the secretary (সচিব) of the school, annual reports, essays, short stories, short plays, etc. in it. It also contains jokes, quizzes (ধাঁধা) and puzzles (শব্দ ধাঁধা), etc. Most of the articles (বিষয়) are written by the students. Besides, a few articles are contributed (প্রদান করা) by the teachers. A school magazine promotes (উন্নয়ন করা) team-spirit (দলীয় উদ্দীপনা), fosters (উৎসাহিত করে) to express the dormant power of thinking as well as writing of the young learners. It also helps flourish (বিকশিত হওয়া) themselves as future writers and poets.

questions.uddipok: Write a composition on " A Journey You Have Recently Enjoyed "

sub_questions.explanation:
A Journey I have recently Enjoyed Or, A Journey by Train

A journey is always pleasurable to me. A journey by train is especially pleasant, because it is safe and comfortable. Whenever I get a chance to travel by train, I never miss it. Last month, I enjoyed a journey by train with my family members from Dhaka to Chattogram. It was one of the most enjoyable journeys in my life.

On the scheduled day, we reached Kamalapur Railway Station early in the morning. The station was very crowded and noisy. We bought our tickets and got into the train. I managed my seat beside a window. Suddenly, the train blew its whistle and I jumped. Then the train began to move.

At first, the train was moving slowly. After a while, it began to move in full speed. Trees, houses, people, etc. all seemed going backwards. Gentle breeze began to enter our compartment. The rhythmic sound and jerking of the train made me very excited. I wanted to put my head out of the window, but my parents did not let me do that. I looked through the window and saw many beautiful sights. The paddy fields and other trees were very beautiful to look at. They were tossing their heads in the breeze. While the train was crossing a bridge, I saw some country-boats in the rivers. Sometimes, our train moved through open fields. I saw the farmers working and the children playing cricket or football there. All these gave me new and exciting experiences.

Our compartment was crowded. There was no vacant seat. Some of the passengers were talking on various topics. Some were reading newspapers or magazines. Some were sleeping, too. Sometimes, hawkers came with various items. Our train made stops at a few big and small'stations. When our train entered Chattogram, I saw many hills.

At last, the train reached Chattogram station at noon. And our journey ended. The journey gave me immense pleasure and experience. I wish I could make it again and again.
